newsitem.title: NORWAY: Hydro 9-mnth profits seen slightly down.
newsitem.headline: Hydro 9-mnth profits seen slightly down.

text.p: Industrial conglomerate Norsk Hydro ASA is expected to post a nine-month result before tax of about 8,825 million crowns, according to eight analysts polled by Reuters.
The comparative figure for last year was 9,023 million for Norway's largest listed company.
For the third quarter alone, analysts expected a pre-tax result of 2,684 million crowns, up from 2,659 million in the third quarter of 1995.
Hydro said on September 30 it expected earnings in the second half of the year to be hit by a recent downturn in aluminium prices.
It added that production problems at the North Sea Lille-Frigg gas condensate field meant it might not be able to fully recover its investment of 470 million crowns in the development.
Analysts were unsure what Hydro will do with the Lille-Frigg development. Some figured the company would make a complete or partial writedown in the third quarter.
Without a possible Lille-Frigg writedown in the third quarter, pre-tax profits of 8,943 million crowns were projected for the first nine months.
Six analysts said buy Hydro shares and two said hold.
Hydro will present the result on October 21.
